viajar arriba.

captions.text: Subscribe to our english channel: Everything about your pet!
https://www.youtube.com/user/allaboutyourpet
I'm going on holiday with Itchy and Scratch.
Take a look at the pet carrier. This is more or less an
ideal transporter to carry two guinea pigs.
Our journey will be by car. Maybe the car is not the most suitable for pets,
I prefer and my experience confirms me that the best
way to travel with animals is, first by train
second by plane and third is the car. The to and fro movements, sudden braking etc, all these
movements stress the animal. When animals are travelling,
the most important is that they are calm, its better to have them covered with something
so they are in darkness, and try to make them do as less movements as possible.
A good way of transporting them is like I have here. I have prepaired a base of Naturlitter
that I think you all well know. It is a bedding made from
newspapers
and Sweet Dreams, that is a bedding
made from cellulose, is here underneath.
I think that you can see it quite well.
Once I have filled in both beddings, I will put in a generous handful
of hay.
Well, we can use
any type of hay, this is not important
I have a packet open here....
Come on, get out a minute...
Come on...
We can use hay for two uses,
One is for a hiding place for the animals which is the most important. And secondly it is
food for them, because they will eat it during the journey if they
feel hungry.
Apart from the hay, we will give them also a
bit of food.
I will fill in with food in an easy place for them, just right here,
in the entrance of the pet transporter.
Its also good for guinea pigs to give them a piece of fruit
or vegetables, fruit will hydrate them that its not even necessary to
give them water
if its a short journey.
If the journey will last 3 or 4 hours, then we will give them a little
bottle with water, that I will show you the best way to put it on.
Come on, lets get inside. Once we have the hay and food, we can
put them inside if we want
then we close the door.
You can see how I will attach the bottle of water to the door.
You have to be careful with the bumps and movements, because if its going
to be d bumpy journey, its better not to give them water,
because the movements will make the water drop and the animals
will reach their destination completely wet.
If its going to be a calm journey, then it is convenient to give them water.
If we stop moving the bottle,
it immediately stops to drip.
We attach this bottle like all the other drinking bottles, as they come with a wire
with hooks on the ends,
and it is very easy to put them in place,
if they will not move much, this is the best way to travel, they have water, food
are safe and they are very comfortable and calm.
It is a good idea to let them previously get familiar with their transporter, even let them sleep inside
for example, leave them inside the transporter for periods of time of five or six hours, which is
the way that they will travel, so they will not find it a strange place.

title: COBAYAS, CUYES  - Cómo viajar con mi mascota
